citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One red and black pig had an injury to its left ear . There was an approximately 1-inch diameter area that is an open
lesion where the underlying skin is reddened. The facility had been treating it, but had not informed the attending
veterinarian on the issue at the time of inspection. A mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that
timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending
veterinarian. Any problems of animal health or behavior must be communicated to the attending veterinarian.
Correct by July 13, 2023

There is not an identifiable, readily available attendant during all areas and times of public contact with animals. The pen
flanking the right side of the entry pathway allows for direct contact with the public to take place through a fence. The pen
contains 4 goats, 2 zebu, 1 sheep, and 3 pigs. At the time of inspection, no dedicated attendant was present to monitor
the public contact.
Without an attendant, animals are at greater risk of experiencing physical injury and behavioral stress, and members of
the public may be at greater risk of injury. Correct by ensuring that a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable
attendants are always present during periods of public contact.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
